Looked at the menu for dayz drooling over their flavors. Lavender yeeeeesssss. I was so excited. Cookie dough bar??? HECK YES!
We traveled to the Streatfood Park, seeing their hours on the Yelp page. Super convenient as this is close to my partner's work. 
So we go in, and the Doughp truck is nowhere to be found. Sad face. Luckily, their stand a few miles away is open! So we run over there. When we enter, it was pretty sad to see. Their menu has about 20 flavors. The stand had containers for half a dozen flavors, and that day they only had 4. Super sad face. 
When we get there we tell the vendor that the Doughp truck is not open at the Streatfood park. She look confused and said it should be and asked if we were sure. She said they may have had an event that night. 
No lavender, no cranberry white chocolate chip. I think they had oatmeal, choc chip, one with oreos and cookies in it, and one other one. Darn. I was really looking forward to the lavender. I did not know that they only had a very small selection of their menu available at any one time. 
So I get a scoop of the chocolate chip, and throw on a candy corn topping. 
Holy Cow. One scoop is $5!! 
Now, it is a pretty small scoop, but after a few bites, you can see why. It is not cold, maybe a little cooler than room temp. The dough is absolutely delicious, but so rich after a few bites. Thankful the scoop is small, sad it cost $5.
Yes, the dough is soooooo good. I would want it in my fridge any time for sure!!! I was super impressed. But in the end, I don't think the product justifies the price. 
Now, if we are ever in the Streatfood park again and Doughp is there, I would order a scoop of their lavender for sure, as the flavor sounds delicious. But I would probably get it to do and put it in my fridge to sneak bites out of. 
4 stars for the product, minus 1 star for the price and the small selection that is actually available at one time.
author: Kat R.

description:
GF'ers rejoice, you finally get to enjoy a fun dessert with everyone else!
After what could be considered a small miscommunication with the DoughP Cookie Bar, I was extremely impressed with the customer service of this cute joint. 
Their cookie dough could have tasted terrible and I would still give them a 5-star review simply based on some of the best customer service I have received in my travels, however, that isnt the case. Their vegan and gluten-free cookie dough was amazing and worth the wait. I will let all fellow Idahoans to make this a stop during their summer visits to SF! 
Thank you again for the amazing customer service, I look forward to coming back!
author: Nicole V.

description:
Went with my Gal to try Doughp, she'd been dying to get there ever since she read about it.  I didn't know anything about it, but the concept sounds cool.  Like others I thought it would be more like ice cream, or refrigerated cookie dough, but it was room temp.  (not refrigerated as claimed by the owner 10 days before our visit)  Like others I think it tastes great for a bite or three.  But you rapidly fill up and just feel kinda "I'm done."  Even my GF, who loves raw food and whatnot, couldn't finish her scoop.
At $5 a scoop (+50 cents per topping) there's no way I would go back, or recommend this to any of my friends.  There's way to many killer dessert places in SF.
author: Jim P.

description: I ordered the Cookie dough latte. It was a basic latte with cookie dough chunks, nothing too special.
author: Lyn R.

description: Who doesn't love cookie dough? This place was so yum! Cute shop with a patio right on the waterfront.  You choose your cookie dough, type of cone and toppings and enjoy the magic!
author: Caitlin M.

description:
I live for cookie dough so when I discovered there was a pop-up that sold straight-up cookie dough, I had to try it! We went to Spark Social SF & immediately found the Doughp stand & were greeted by two employees. They let us try the flavors & I was torn between the s'mores & m&ms. I ended up choosing one scoop of the M&Ms with oats cookie dough on a waffle cone with round sprinkles on top. 

The cookie dough was soooo good! I wish I also had a side of ice cream along with it to pair it up. Next time, I plan on buying a container of the cookie dough so I could do this at home.

My only complaint was when I got to the cone, it was very stale. No crunch left whatsoever. I guess I'm picky about this because I'm a cone head so the cone completes the dessert. But I do love how they have a bowl of sprinkles out for you to top off yourself!

Will definitely be back! Thank you Doughp for creating delicious cookie dough!
author: Trisha G.

description:
Nutella oreo was on point
Very instagrammable spot as well!
Got a scoop and it was gone in 5!
author: Alexis G.

description: Warning you might get a terrible stomach ache!! Few bites and to the trash they both went due to stomach aches . Not worth it. $6 a scoop plus $1.50 for a colored cone .50 for a stale sugar cone and toppings. Cookie dough is warm. Even when putting it in a fridge at home it stayed hot. Has an artificial vanilla taste with lots of sugar. Taste dry. My friend got a upset stomach so did I. Nothing special here . The cookie dough in a tub from Target that was $4 tasted waaaay better than this place. Cute overall but wouldn't try again. Ended up with heart burn and stomach issues
author: Cindy V.

description: Super slow, waited in a insanely short line for ten minutes. And then THIS is what you get?! For $7.05 it's a tiny scoop of cookie dough. They ran out of cones as well! THERE WAS A HAIR IN THE DOUGH AS WELL!!! Ridiculous.
author: Izzy C.

description: I was super excited to go here because it's such a cool concept! As soon as I arrived there was a line out the door, which made me even more pumped! But there weren't that many cookie dough selections, and the price board caught my eye. It was pretty pricy; $6 for one scoop, $10 for two, and $13 for three! The staff was not super cheery. The truly appalling incident was when my friend was at the cashier paying. The employee ringing her up casually said, "what the f***"  to herself. She stated it loudly, and failed to even apologize. The cookie dough was good, but the service was poor.
author: Lucia L.

description: The dairy free option is meh. The rest of the selections (with butter) are quite good. If they could rework the dairy free (also gluten free), I'd give it another shot.
author: Nic F.

description: What a great idea! Points for novelty and delivery. Recommended by a friend as a must- do at the Pier, and I would strongly agree. Sadly, I am capable of making classic chocolate chip cookie dough to my own personal taste - should have gotten the oreo dough w/ blue food color called "Cookie Monster"! Also loved the assorted "flavored" cones. They were pretty, but I didn't feel my red velvet cone was of the taste advertised. Not to say it wasn't v tastey! Overall, great experience!
author: Julia L.

description:
Not impressed at all. No selection. No excitement. Just a blah scoop of cookie dough. 
All hype !!!!!!!
author: Dale J.

description: I visited DOUGHP during the Grand Opening. I didn't mind having to wait 45 minutes and I'm sure this won't be the norm. There's limited signage, so you have to ask what's in every flavor. They have interesting names like OG, Amber Rose, and White Girl. I was perplexed to why a scoop of cookie dough would be $6--seems a little outrageous even for SF standards. Once you do get your scoop, be prepared to stand as there isn't much space inside the Myriad.
author: Laurisha C.

description: Tried the birthday cake cookie dough and Nutella Oreo cookie dough and they were both really good. I need to definitely come back and try the other flavors. The workers were really nice as well.
author: Javier J.

description: Shocked to pay $18 for three scoops of cookie dough. In a cup, as a cone would have been extra. No toppings, as they would have been extra. Cookie dough itself was pretty bland (edit: I got the vegan flavor, so the others might taste better). Bummer as I really wanted to like this place.
author: Chris N.

description:
I attended the grand opening yesterday and I'd say Doughp is a 3.5 star place as is. 

No samples, and the person who scooped my flavors seemed particularly exacting with having a flat bottomed scoop rather than letting it be round as if it were actually ice cream. If you are going to scoop and serve cookie dough like ice cream and price it higher than even fancy ice cream per scoop, you should give nice round generous scoops. 

The cookie doughs I got were the White Girl and This Smore is Hella Lit. Both good, a bit too sweet for an adult palette. I also can see the sweet and dense dough tasting lighter if the dough were refrigerated, or maybe with some air beaten in. After all, lots of people have memories eating premade cookie dough out of the fridge, which is what this is. 

Overall this is a great concept but don't forget it's cookie dough, not macarons or ice cream. It probably isn't worth $6 a scoop if Salt and Straw is only $5.00 or $5.50 for a single round scoop with artisanal ingredients.
author: Chibi K.

description: Literally the DOUGHPEST cookie dough I've ever had! Love the look, feel, tastes and flow of what Doughp brings to the table for the local foodies and a twist on dessert. I mean who doesn't remember eating cookie dough out of your moms baking bowl as a kid?! This way you aren't getting in trouble and indulging in your sweet tooth! Love this place!
author: Emily S.

description: I need to start this review with the fact that I'm not a huge fan of cookie dough ice cream, so going here was an after-thought to the poke bowl shop 5 feet across the way. The cookie dough is pretty interesting! It's much softer than what you get in ice cream and the combinations Doughp offers are pretty fun. However, I am glad I checked this out, but would rather grab some ice cream or better yet, fro yo!!!
author: Lisa R.

description:
It really tastes like cookie dough regardless of the fact that it's not made with eggs! The stand itself in the SF Social Spark venue is small and simple! My boyfriend and I ordered the Oreo flavored cookie dough, and although it impressively tasted like cookie dough.. we could not really understand the trend. Immediately after the first bite, we were walking around the rest of the venue looking for milk to wash it down. It's SOOOO rich. I could probably eat one spoonful a day at most. Too much for me. The idea is cute! I'm sure cookie dough lovers loveeeee it! I thought I was a cookie dough person, but after this place, I'll have to re-evaluate myself. I think that I would have given this place four stars for the impressive cookie dough taste! But five dollars for one scoop of dough my boyfriend and I simply could not swallow all down was a risky investment that we felt wasn't worth the try. 
SORRY! I really wanted to like this place especially with all the hype and videos on social media! I also Uber Eats delivered my friend in Utah the Mint Oreo flavor from DOUGHP as well, and she had the same reaction although she's got a sweet tooth too.
author: Kim N.

description: Definitely a must-try if you're by Pier 39! We had already planned on going to Pier 39 when I saw a video on Doughp ok Facebook. I was so intrigued about a cookie dough bar, and was even more excited that it was already where we planned on being. Highly recommend - it was a cool experience :)
author: Marie P.

description: Please read why I star this a 1. Reason being is I stayed in line for a long period of time and to find out it is not ice cream nor is it yogurt . It's actually just cookie dough, there was no ice cream just cookie dough served on a cone!... if ice cream and yogurt is served warm well then I'm wrong. I ordered the m&m dough and was not happy...
author: Thinh-Charlie H.

description: Came to the Myriad specifically to try Doughp. After tasting the "Eminem" flavor I saw this bug sitting on top of the cookie dough bins. I was immediately grossed out and didn't end up buying Doughp.
author: Kaela R.

description: What's not to love about cookie dough especially if you don't have "Don't eat cookie dough raw" on the packaging. Amazing marketing skills and delicious doughp! I was even able to bring some home since there was no raw eggs it doesn't need to be refrigerated!
author: Bella S.

description:
Absolutely OBSESSED with Doughp.  I was the kid who would bake to eat cake batter and cookie dough  - and get a tummyache - so being served straight up EDIBLE cookie dough is a dream come true. My Favorite Flavor: S'mores Hella Lit 

I've followed this spot since they started at Spark Social  - and i'm so happy they have a permanent house at the Myriad. The Myriad is a cool, lively little spot with a variety of food/drink vendors -  would make a great place to stop in on a date! 

P.S Also, talk about 'grammable! From the playful branding, fun photo backdrops - this dessert is *seriously* photogenic.
author: Shilpa R.

description:
Raw cookie dough that's safe to eat?? It's so good. Except that it's expensive. Kind of the same price as touristy/hipster ice cream.

Make sure you sample before you buy! The first time I came here the scoop was so dry and crumbly and gross because it was an old batch from the end of the day. I'm so glad I gave it a second chance though because the second time I went it was creamy and delicious. My favorite is definitely the original chocolate chip flavor. I wish they sold pints in store because I would take home so many if I could.

The interior of the store is also really cute. They have a neon sign that says "legit cookie dough". It's upstairs at Fisherman's wharf if you're looking for it.
author: Kelly T.

description: Super tasty treat! A little pricey, but actually tastes exactly like legit cookie dough, they aren't messing around. Oreo is my fav!
author: Natalie G.

description:
Super cute booth! I am a sucker for neon blue signs.

I always wanted to try the new cookie dough hype so when I heard of a place in San Francisco that carried it, I was super down! I decided to get the Matcha Scoop which was good, and super sweet, little too sweet for me, but if you have a super sweet tooth, it's for you! I like the mixture of white chocolate with the Matcha, it's a honest classic combo. Personally for me, I thought the one scoop was good enough to share with 1-3 people since how sweet and heavy this dessert is. I did feel a tiny bit sick after eating this dessert, but that could just be a me thing, because I am not used to all this sugary sweetness. 

I ended up paying $7, with a cone and drizzle for this one scoop, which was my bad because I did not pay enough attention to the signs of extra charge. The birthday cake cone is a good choice for me, I'd do say so myself.

All in all, I was happy to experience cookie dough at this place! I'd think I'd go again one day, and try out other flavors.
author: Diane N.

description: Amazingly delicious!!  Why bake it when you can eat it raw!!!!  The OG is great and the other seasonal flavors are fire too!!  Heat treated flour and no egg for the win!!!  Had a chance to meet and chat with the owner Kelsey, love her story!!  Cant wait to come back for more!!
author: Dave T.

description:
If you love licking the spoon while making cookies, this is for you.
I loved it.....
Tried the flavors:
Salted caramel pretzel, original, & mint cookie. 
I got the mint and it was really good. Split it with my bf. The lady working was super sweet. 
I should have got her name. She let my bf and I try all of the flavors we wanted.
No complaints, I am so glad I finally got to try a place that serves cookie dough since seeing the videos all over Facebook. Get a scoop-split it - no regerts
author: Julia R.

description: Went to this place with my daughter's and the music of chose was NOT family friendly at all, f word left and right along with it being super loud. Will not be back.
author: Gara F.

description: Overpriced - $6 for a tiny cup of cookie dough. TINY cup! It was good but I would never purchase cookie dough from here again due to the price.
author: Gabrielle M.

description:
A taste is free, and that's all it'll take to get you addicted to Doughp!  

We visited this fun little kiosk on their grand opening night, and while we waited in line for a little bit, I can assure you all, it's quite worth it.  Have you ever had a scoop of cookie dough ice cream, and wondered why you can't just have a bunch more dough?  These folks have figured it out - they'll fill that cone with PURE edible (no eggs) cookie dough, and it's guaranteed to please!  

We walked in to find a bunch of fun, inventive flavors - lots of great choices, but I'm old school, so had to stay true to my roots, and stick with the OG (Chocolate Chip, of course!).  We picked out flavors, picked our choice of vessel, and then tried some fun toppings, too!  What a fun treat!  

Now, about the service...  Let me say, I'm no stranger to opening shops in San Francisco.  Grand openings can be tough, and are often stressful and grueling.  You'd NEVER know this by chatting with their team!  This is a gang of folks who TRULY believe in the product they're offering, they take their time with you to help guide your experience, and do it with a super-bubbly smile, even at the end of a long day (We arrived just a few minutes before closing!).  Their warm, friendly hospitality made me want to hang out with them for hours - I've got 4 new besties!  

Thanks, Doughp crew, for giving me a great excuse to cheat on my diet.  I promise to return again and again and again!
author: Stephen V.

description:
I wasn't exactly sure how to feel by the end of the experience. I've been wanting to try a cookie dough place since I heard of one opening in NYC. Naturally I was psyched to hear of one opening in SF. 

It's located in a tiny food market in mission/dolores. The price seemed realllyyyy steep for one scoop ($5!) and all of the toppings were an extra $0.50. Regardless, I tried the s'mores and it was good. Not great, but good. I expected it to be a little cooler, but it wasn't a deal breaker. I realized you really only do need one scoop because it's very dense and filling. I kind of got tired of the texture toward the end of it. I wanted toppings but to spend close to $7 on such a little thing seemed excessive. It was a nice little experience but not something I'd be dying to have again.
author: Megan F.

description:
I like to come here, sit at the bar facing the street, and eat my scoop of cookie dough while watching all the sweaty people get out of 24 Hour Fitness next door. It make me feel.. good. 

It's like an ice cream shop, but instead of ice cream scoops, it's cookie dough scoops. Interesting flavors, I just got rosewater. Yes, rosewater cookie dough. They have matcha flavor too but it looks like diarrhea. Very pricey for cookie dough but cool idea. Serving sizes are super big I couldn't finish one scoop.
author: Jakob Eats Alone ..

description: Interesting place! Cute venue with a bar, poke bowl place, another food kiosk and doughp. Very open and spacious . Tried the original cookie dough. It's yummy but I can't eat too much it's just really sweet!! You can try different samples they had a matcha one as well. Worth trying at least once!
author: Stacie S.

description:
**Updating review to 3 stars instead of 2. The shop owner contacted me directly via Instagram DM and expressed her sincere apologies for my experience. She also refunded my previous order for me. The shop owner has always been nice and I'm sure if I reached out previously, she would've tried to better my experience.**

I was a huge fan of Doughp and was going once a week ever since their soft opening at the Myriad. I grew up loving cookie dough so this place was a dream come true for me. The cookie dough was pricey but I was willing to pay because of my love for cookie dough. However, after having 2 incidents with the cleanliness of the cookie dough, I will not be returning. 

Every visit I would purchase two or even three of the $10 double scoop of OG or Eminem to go. During one sitting, I spooned out some dough and found a green string like thing. It definitely wasn't edible and should not have been in the dough. I contacted Doughp via Instagram DM and the owner told me to stop by and she'll take care of me. I went the next day and the shop was actually closed so she didn't have any cookie dough to switch out for me. She took a look at the green thing in the dough and said it was a piece of sponge and said they would be more careful in the future. I had to return a second time to switch out my dough and didn't even receive any free dough for the inconvenience. The owner was nice and responded quickly but I was hoping for more, especially since I was a super fan customer and always purchased multiple containers of dough.

Anyways, I put the first incident behind and continued to be a loyal customer. I had a container of OG doughp that I was eating over the course of a few days. My very last bite, there was a light brown hair stuck in the dough. I had to pull the piece of hair out of my mouth and almost threw up, I was so disgusted. I was especially grossed out because the hair was sitting in the dough the whole time I had it in the fridge, which was a few days and who knows how much longer at their shop. I didn't bother to contact the shop owner because of the previous experience. I didn't have the time or energy to waste driving back down to their store just for them to exchange it. It was my last bite so there was nothing left to exchange anyways. It was this incident that made me no longer be a customer here. I've not been back since.
author: Jodi H.

description: I was so excited to see that a cookie dough place opened up in SF. Cookie dough is my absolute favorite dessert, and after living in NYC and having Dō on campus at my school, I was spoiled. I do have to say that Doughp can definitely do better if they had a bigger space since it's part of a market. I think they'd be able to have more variety of flavors. I wish the cookie dough was refrigerated since it didn't give the same sense of enjoyment as one would feel pulling out cookie dough from the freezer. I definitely think it's overpriced, compared to Dō in NYC - that place gave two hefty scoops for a small and was around the same price. However, my love for cookie dough gives this place a 4 stars simply because they are the first in San Francisco to do this, and I'm sure will only get better from here
author: Kaitna S.

description: FUN treat!  I couldn't eat more than 2 bites because it is so sweet & I don't like sweet stuff but the 2 bites I ate were DELICIOUS with the peanut butter drizzled on top.  My boyfriend loved it too!
author: Kim M.

description:
Cookie dough is one of my very favorite things in the whole entire world. I have tried Edoughble. I have tried Cookie Dough Bites. I've tried edible cookie dough Pinterest recipes. I've even eaten bowls of the real stuff, including homemade, Cougar Mountain, and Pillsbury/Nestle tubes and trays. I've always been disappointed, or afraid of getting salmonella.

So when I saw their stand at the Great Mac 'N Cheese Melt-Off, my expectations were low. I even told my boyfriend, "I hope they're bad so I never have to buy them again."

Dammit.

They were good.

They. Were. So. Good.

The OG (regular chocolate chip) is the best cookie dough I've ever had. It has the perfect flavor and texture. I don't have to worry about eating raw eggs. And the owner and everyone who worked at the stand was so incredibly happy and friendly.

I know it was a mac 'n cheese event, but it was the best thing there.

Doughp, my tastebuds thank you. I will be back.
author: Season H.

description: I'm usually a sweet tooth! I really am. I love cookie dough and DOUGHP is such a great concept. So glad to have something like it land in SF since do in New York is super popular. I had the Nutella Oreo and it was too sweet for me. However, would love to try out other flavors once I'm in town again.
author: Kaithleen A.

description: I love cookie dough so had to try this while at Pier 39. Overall it was good but very rich. The various flavors of dough tasted nearly the same. You get a full ice cream scoop worth, which is a lot considering how rich it is. The toppings help add some variety but can get expensive. Worth one visit, but I don't see myself making this a regular stop when at Pier 39.
author: Brian A.

description: Unapologetically had a spoonful of this magical creation this morning before my workout class!  I ordered a shipment of "this smore is hella lit," and it did NOT disappoint.  If you haven't already tried some of this stuff, you need to! I'm officially hooked.
author: Alyssa T.

description: Different sweet product for those feeling something else besides ice cream. I love cookie dough so I'm a fan. A bit pricey but still a decent treat every so often.
author: Jessica A.

description: Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Offered samples and made recommendations!  Cookie dough was delicious and very filling even just one scoop! Was really happy to have found this cool place!
author: Rebecca K.

description: Good dough but needs ice cream on the side. Good variety of flavors but it's just too heavy to eat on its own. Cool location and love the little balcony out back.
author: Ana A.

description:
I made my first order of Doughp about a week ago.  The product arrived promptly in an attractive package.  One bite and I can tell you I'm hooked on Doughp!  It doesn't fit well with my current efforts at healthy eating and weight loss, so I'm savoring it over the long haul, but I eat a small spoonful each night just to get my fix.

I'll be ordering more, you can count on that.
author: Kevin T.

description: Love Doughp! The cookie dough itself is to die for, tastes just like the kind you get out of the package- maybe even better. Unique flavors keep it interesting and delicious, the s'mores is my personal favorite. The waffle cones are also featured in unique delicious flavors. Toppings are also available which is great. Staff is super friendly, atmosphere is also great! Super cute instagram opportunity with the lit up wall in the back, and the seating in the back is super great to get a nice view of the pier down below. Totally recommend this place!
author: Sydney G.

description: Disappointing. You can make better at home with little effort, and the vegan flavor was down-right bad.
author: Alyson B.

description: One word to describe DOUGHP.....amazing!!! Their cookie dough is excellent raw yet also sooooo tasty baked! My wife and I were able to order all the way to NY and it arrived perfect just days later. Being able to order this cookie dough gold across the country brings happiness to our household! Big thank you to the DOUGHP family!
author: Mike S.

description: If you love cookie dough, I totally recommend for you to come here. They give free samples of any flavors! The flavor names are soooo hilarious, there's one flavor that's called "Basic Betch" because it was pumpkin spice cookie dough. I ordered the "This S'mores is Hella Awesome". It consist of marshmallow, graham, chocolate chips and cookie dough. I was surprised that the cookie dough wasn't hard as rock nor soft as jelly. It was the perfect texture. Even one scoop is so filling!
author: Kristi A.

description: Very nice twist on ice cream, actually it is cookie dough. Had chirardelli mocha and very good choice for cold evening at the pier.
author: Tony P.

description: I really wanted to love Doughp! A dessert cafe that just sells the best formative stage of a cookie? We were in the mood for dessert and wandered up here (the location is unfortunately out of the way), and decided to get a scoop. We tried a few of the flavours and ended up walking out empty handed. Not sure whether the cookie dough just tasted differently or if it was the lack of alternatives / context that made cookie dough such a compelling delight when baking. Friendly staff and a decent menu, otherwise.
author: Sunil S.

description: The place is hidden on the pier. It took me a second to find it. I tried the Blondie. It was really good. And the staff was really friendly. I will definitely come back when I am in town again
author: Annalynn J.

description: Love the cookie dough!! Great atmosphere in a convenient location too. My only suggestion would be for more flavors!
author: Johnny S.

description: It's just too good! So many yummy flavors and always something new to try- be bold and try all of the fun flavors! And to top it all off the doughp dealers always provide great customer service
author: Claire T.

description: I went inside with my friend Julianne to try this place out for the first time. We loved it to much. The cookie dough was amazing. You can either put it on a cup or on a specialty cone. The girl we met her name was Kelsey was super friendly and featured us on their IG page! I would def go back and order cookie dough and ha e fun with pictures and boomerangs in there. The place is a okay Ly beautiful.
author: Ariel D.

description:
I was really excited to try Doughp, but it just didn't cut it for me. We ordered a few different scoops, but no one in my party of four was really into any of it and we ended up throwing most of the dough away. 

That being said, the man at the counter was so nice and helpful. I just wish it tasted a little better!
author: K. D.

description: Absolutely amazing for cookie dough lovers like myself! The employees were very friendly, cookie dough was DELICIOUS (i got chocolate chip with caramel drizzle), nice small seating outside, and tasty Illy coffee (we got an americano and a caramel late). My only complaint is that I wish they had some more flavors.. hopefully there will be more to come in the future :)
author: Marie O.

description: Interesting concept but on a warm day a warm dough in an ice cream cone isn't going to cut it. Interesting flavors but I can't buy into the concept... maybe I missed something??
author: Lillian S.

description: Ordered the original from Uber eats because I fly out tomorrow but wanted to try. While the price is not bad I was disappointed in the taste. While I am sure it's healthier (better ingredients) than my usual cookie dough (nestle toll house or similar) I expected it to be better tasting.
author: Nathan L.

description: I ordered a small serving of chocolate chip DOUGHP delivery as part of another meal. The dough was incredibly good and the best part! Brought back memories of baking with my sister and eating a little bit of cookie dough on its own. DOUGHp dough tastes delicious and 100% legit and I will absolutely be back for more!
author: Meg B.

description: Love Love love cookie dough. And this place was run by the owner herself, something about that makes it taste even better.
author: Bill S.

description:
THE BEST DESSERT IN SAN FRANCISCO, PERIOD!!! Before I begin to comment on the cookie dough, I would like to focus my attention on the actual establishment. First and foremost it is impeccably clean. A seasoned foodie, I occasionally am willing to forego modern sanitation in the quest for good eats from any number of dives. I am glad I don't have to make that choice at DOUGHP. No dust, no crumbs and no fingerprints on the glass. Second but equally important, organization. From the cookie dough and toppings to the serving utensils and signage, it is clear that careful planning went into presentation. When you approach the bar, there is no confusion as to where you place an order or pay for that order. Finally, what makes this place really special is the people. They're not preoccupied in the background on their phones or engaged in meaningless chit chat. When you walk in, immediately their attention is focused on you, the customer. Eye contact and warm smiles are followed by a warm greeting. Owner Kelsey is passionate about her product and is happy to introduce you to the world of all things cookie dough. Her and the team members at DOUGHP are down to earth, genuine and leave no doubt in your mind that your business is appreciated. These qualities are huge for those versed in the art of eating, especially when you're drawn 700 miles away from home to experience what San Francisco does best, FOOD! 

Of course there is the cookie dough. I never imagined such flavors and variety were possible. It looks good, smells great and tastes even better. Samples are as plentiful as the patience of the staff here which lends to the fun atmosphere.Then there is the value. No conservative serving sizes that leave you less than satisfied here. Although my little ones had no problem polishing off their cookie dough cones, I was impressed that I was hard pressed to finish my bowl. Comfortable seating, no crowds, and dedicated restrooms seal the deal. Try saying that about Fisherman's Wharf or the Mission. For you tourist parents such as myself, yes this is a completely safe, family friendly location with easy access and plenty of parking. When you need a break from all the tourist spots and pricey dining in the city, keep DOUGHP'S address close by. You'll find a wide array of pinball machines with chill music in the background to relax to. I would highly recommend visiting DOUGHP before this hidden gem finds its way to Travel Channel and Food Network notoriety. Thanks to Kelsey and the staff at DOUGHP for adding a little magic to our vacation.
author: Ed M.

description: A little goes a long way!! But man was this dough good. I've always loved eating cookie dough, but stopped due to salmonella risk. Finally I can enjoy as much as I want without the fear of food poisoning! Order on Postmates for the full glutinous experience (and no circling for parking spots!). I love dessert a little too much, so I rarely have trouble finishing a medium portion of ice cream or similar dessert. That being said, one scoop is DEFINITELY enough cookie dough for one person. Kids or someone without a sweet tooth should definitely split a scoop. Not that it's not super good...it just fills you up quite quickly!
author: Kathleen P.

description: I feel pretty duped trying this place. From the photos it looks pretty tasty and unique. At $5 a scoop (with no toppings or cone) it is more expensive than any ice cream in the city yet I imagine that it is incredibly cheaper and easier to make. And also trivial to make by 6 year old. I had the Smores cookie dough and it wasn't bad, but not good either. There was nothing really special about it, and I've definitely made better cookie dough myself (when I bake cookies, of course :P)  And like other reviewers said, after eating like half a scoop you get over it and it just becomes unappetizing. I just can't see this kind of business lasting very long.
author: Andrew D.

description: Wow, I am totally obsessed with this business. I've been wanting to try edible, egg-free cookie dough since I saw Dō -- a similar business -- open in New York City last fall. But I think Doughp might actually be better! The s'mores, OG and M&M flavors are my favorite. The new Konery cones are also great. Gotta love that red velvet flavor. 10/10 would recommend.
author: Lizzie J.

description: ugh.. they moved and now I can't figure out how to delete this.. so I'll bump it to 4 stars.. cookie people, buy me a cookie. next time i'm in SF and maybe you'll earn the 5th :-)
author: Derek B.

description: Talk about the BIGGEST LET DOWN EVER.  I've been waiting and waiting for this place to open because I LOVE cookie dough.  After going to this place I definitely won't be back.  The cookie dough is ROOM TEMPERATURE like EW I thought it would at least be cold but if anything it was warm.  I'll risk getting salmonella and eat regular cookie dough.  Thanks.
author: Sierra W.

description: This has probably been one of the best food experiences of the year!! I was not disappointed in the least!! I love the owner, the employees, the atmosphere, the flavors, omgoodness the flavors!!! Can you say out of this world!!! I am so glad I took the time to check this out. It was definitely DoughP!! I will return!! It's the perfect location!!!
author: Britne L.

description: This place is absolutely amazing! The employees are friendly, the cookie dough is great. Its very airy and fluffy, not sure how they do it, but it adds something special to the flavor. My friend and I came yesterday night and we will for sure be back. We loved it so, so much! We will be bringing family and friends too!
author: Julia R.

description: Interesting concept. We stumbled upon this quaint place on pier 39 ! Happy accident! We had the elder rose cookie dough and the oero Nutella cookie dough. The elder rose was unique and absolutely delicious!! Oreo Nutella dough tasted as expected and delightful . This place also has excellent coffee.
author: Pallavi R.

description: Eh. Not that great. Cookie dough was pretty much hot which made it pretty gross overall. Pretty much like eating a hot scoop of sugar. Expected it to be colder. Also, cashier was very rude. Not too great of service
author: Audrey A.

description: It tastes really good but it is insanely priced! $6 for a tiny little scoop and all toppings are extra. I got chocolate syrup on mine for $0.50 more and they barely put any on. Total it was over $7 and although it is good it is definitely not worth that price.
author: Taylor L.

description: Great idea (I am a self-diagnosed cookie dough addict), but doesn't do it for me. The dough isn't cold nor does it taste as good as store bought brands. Service was fantastic.
author: Ian T.

description: My niece was turned pon to this place when we walked by on our way to the Crab House for lunch.  After, we came back & were in awe of all the flavors & a place that only specializes in cookie dough for that matter.  M&M, Oreo, nutella, just to name a few; I tried a sample of the oreo & nutella & decided on the nutella.  Like the Oreo, it was sublimly smooth & full of flavor.  This place is a bit expensive as three scoops were $19.00, but it is Pier 39 after all & regardless, well worth it.  You can eat inside or out on their little padio.  The girl behind the counter was very friendly & patient while we made our decisions.  I would definitely come back.  So, for some wonderful cookie dough for a bit more than what you would usually pay, Doughp cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.
author: Brian S.

description: I bought a Gilt City voucher to check these guys out. No regrets! They arrived at my home a few days after ordering. So tasty. Will def be ordering more.
author: Laura G.

description: We ordered Doughp from the online store because we don't live in the bay area, and I was just that curious! It arrived, beautifully packaged (thrill 1) and we dug right in. YUM! Thrill2! Guilt-free yummy-ness. Yes, it's rich and sweet. It's supposed to be. You have to try this! I can't wait to get more!
author: DIana H.

description: The cookie dough these guys whip up is incredibly rich and very sweet. I was definitely a fan of both the dessert and the service. It's a really fun novelty treat, albeit terribly overpriced.
author: Kayla S.

description: Ordered a three pack of Doughp to be delivered to Hillsboro Oregon. The Doughp came super fast, and was packaged perfectly - so fun to open! Saved my Doughp until I could share it with friends. We ate it scooped into tiny ice cream cones - amazing! We tried White Girl, This S'More is Hella Lit, and The OG. All three were amazing, but The OG and S'More flavors took a slight lead... chocolate, you know! Looking forward to my next order. Thanks Kelsey and Doughp!
author: Katrina M.

description: As a natural rebel, I thought that trying a cookie dough that couldn't actually kill me wouldn't be nearly as satisfying. I was SO wrong. This cookie dough tastes exactly like every spatula I ate from while sitting on the kitchen counter as a little kid. I was sure "The OG" would be my favorite since chocolate chip is a true classic, and although it was amazing, "White Girl" blew my mind and had me dipping into the fridge before bed, before work, on my lunch hour, and basically any time I needed a sweet fix. I'm all about that Doughp life!!
author: Heather W.

description: She had me at "You Jelly!" Oh my...wonderful smooth peanut butter, mixed beautifully with strawberry preserves. The crunchiness of the cone filled with with this incredible edible dough from heaven. It took me back to my Grandma's counter eating dough out of the bowl faster than she could bake. The owner's passion is inspiring! Fortunately she is going to be extremely successful because she delivers, ships and caters events. My addiction is in full swing and easily fed with weekly deliveries. Don't wait, go to www.doughpsf.com and order! You'll be forever changed!
author: Megan Reeves ..

description: DOUGHP is amazing!! Get the variety "Indecision" pack and you won't be disappointed!!  I will definitely be ordering more.
author: Jen W.

description: I had to order my doughp online and have it shipped to me since I don't have Doughp's delicious goodness within driving distance. Once it arrived (which was mega fast btw), my cousin and I had consumed all 24 oz in less than 2 days at which time I promptly placed an order for an additional 48 oz of doughp! It's addicting, be careful- BUT, it does go wonderfully with milk. I'll be in serious trouble if a monthly subscription option becomes available!
author: A H.

description: Great concept! The owner and workers were super nice and very friendly. Extremely expensive "dough"  I enjoyed the cookie dough but I wouldn't pay for it again. I get that they are a new company but I feel like $6 for ONE scoop of dough is way too much.
author: Sabrina K.

description: Small location based upstairs at the fisherman's wharf. This is 100% cookie dough, and it tastes great. Yum
author: Ryan G.

description: By far the best store on Pier 39! Delicious cookie dough bar, eat it raw or bring it home and bake it. A variety of flavors including Nutella, smores, and classic chocolate chip. Amazingly friendly and kind staff, highly recommend to everyone!
author: Monique M.

description: Dough lacks flavor.  Yuck!  They need to add more vanilla and dark brown sugar!  My kids didn't even want more than 2 bites. NOT at all worth the wait or the hype.  Wish we had skipped this and opted for the mini-doughnuts instead.
author: Kathryn W.

description: Not very good. Would only let us try 1 sample barley enough to even taste. Expensive for the amount they give. Not worth the money.
author: Alexis G.

description: Lover of cookie dough but this place sure disappoints. Dough was mushy and room temperature. Atmosphere was cool, had upbeat music but not appropriate for little kids to hear. Parents beware.
author: K K.

description:
Came across this place on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try especially because it's literally a 2-minute walk away from me! 

I tried the OG and the Oreo flavor! The OG is like an original chocolate chip cookie dough flavor and the Oreo flavor was like the OG, but without the chocolate chips and it was replaced with Oreos instead! I gotta say I'm quite impressed! It is very creamy and sweet, but towards the end it became a bit too sweet. I suggest drinking it with cold water or cold milk! I think it would be even better though if the dough was cold! 

Overall, I will be coming back again when I have a
cookie dough crave because cookie dough is life! And this place definitely reminded me of my childhood memories! Creative and great idea for all the sweet tooths that have a thing for cookie dough!
author: Sharali T.

description: The dough tastes so good and there are many topping to choose from! Their neon lights are excellent to take pictures with, not to mention that the people are so nice. I had lost my wallet and they shipped it back to me! Great dessert great people what more can one ask for?
author: Brian N.

description: Me and my gf went here and tried it for the first time. I had the og chocolate chip and it was very good and my gf had the smores one and she enjoyed it also. Def a new cool concept.
author: Jake W.

description: Super yummy! Vegan options too! Who would of thought cookie dough could be scooped out like ice cream. Sign me up.
author: Scott H.

description: DAMN YOU!!!!  Why did you come to my neighborhood.  There was nothing great in the food hall on Market and Church which was a good thing and now...now...YOU come along.  You with your awesome cookie dough flavors.  You with your friendly service.  I am huge as a house and can't lose an ounce and then you come 1 block away.  Sigh.  I will be your new number one fan.  Congratulations on your opening.  I KNOW you will take off!
author: Eli B.

description: this place is incredible i love cookie dough and i want this in a cone next time. i also want to try a different flavor. the s'mores one is incredible
author: Charlotte M.

description: The most amazing dessert shop in SF! Everyone should try this raw cookie dough bar -- they have the best flavors and incredible customer service. The scoops are really big and they offer to-go options and are on UberEats, plus there's a toppings bar. The Myriad also has cool neighboring shops, so if you're looking for a cool night out, hit it up! I tried the S'Mores Hella Lit and was blown away. 5 stars for sure!
author: Courtney C.

description:
We ordered DOUGHP online on a Sunday and it was delivered hella quick on Tuesday. (5) flavors delivered ... if you happen to know the DOUGHP Dealer !!! We sampled all five  (all very good) and I have to say for me it's a toss up between "THIS S'MORE IS HELLA LIT" and "WHITE GIRL", my wife's favorite was "YOU JELLY?"

Then we actually baked the DOUGHP ... weird I know but ... who'd a thunk it. BOOM!!! The DOUGHP is legit both ways !! It really is the BEST of both worlds!! Monthly subscription ?? Yes, please. Thanks DOUGHP
author: Greg W.

description: This place was great! I had the OG flavor with sprinkles and it was awesome. I really recommend if you like cookie dough. They have a couple of flavors and toppings. It's a small pop up in an area with a lot of food trucks and the like so it's also perfect to get a meal there too. Highly recommend. Super friendly and tasty cookie dough!
author: Celaena G.

description: Love their cookie dough! The owner is super nice and accommodating and I cannot wait for her to be able to open her own shop! Definitely recommend getting your cookie dough here
author: Monica M.

description: Confession: my order for Doughp was JUST now placed but I have been scheming for awhile to get some! This review is for the simplicity and ease of use of the webpage. Ordered two flavors and a t-shirt all on my mobile phone. Update will come when the deliciousness is delivered!
author: Mckayla G.

description: Doughp happened to be at an event i was at this past weekend so I thought why not try some Doughp....it was amazing. You might think "edible Cookie dough can't I just buy this in store" NO you cannot! This stuff is amazing! And it has no egg so no need to worry about having to cook it. Just grab a spoon and have movie night! Can't wait for more!!!
author: Hazel L.

description: The service was good, and the cookie dough was alright,  but it is served room temperature and that takes away from the flavor and the texture tbh. It's too sweet and sticky. Even though it isn't necessary to chill the dough I really think that the overall flavor would be improved by doing so.
author: Nirel B.

description: Loved everything about my experience with ordering Doughp! Aside from the Cookie Dough being amazing, my overall experience from placing the order, receiving my order and diving into the cookie dough couldn't have been a better one!  Will be ordering again!
author: Theresa H.

description:
This review has been updated below :) 
Update*** Oct 16th. 
Hi, the owner of Doughp has gone out of her way to remedy my experience from this past weekend and I'm happy to say the customer service since has been so great although I still would love to try the products. I've been offered a couple of incentives from my experience and I appreciate the effort. Not all businesses try to correct incidents or unfortunate issues like this. Thanks y'all, I appreciate it. 
Original: 
Literally unbelievable. I showed up on vacation to come and see this place and try it and it was during Their normal business hours but NO ONE WAS WORKING I asked another vendor and they said someone stepped out but no one came to replace them. So I called the number and a woman picked up the phone to say that there was a scheduling issue but didn't even offer me an incentive after telling me it'd be a 20 min wait before another employee would show up. I'm really disappointed because I'm on vacation and got an Uber just to bring me here. If ANYONE from this company reaches out to fix this I'll update this review. Thanks.
author: David Mikael W.

description: I LOVE this place. The employees are always courteous and helpful. The food is so sophisticated and interesting while somehow keeping it simple. The atmosphere is fun and vibrant that puts everyone in a fun mood. I would recommend to anyone and everyone!
author: Nicholas H.

description: Doughp is awesome! Not only is the cookie dough amazing, but so is the staff! My boyfriend and I went on the hunt for this place a few nights ago and walked around and were about to give up but figured we would give them a call. Keep in mind it was about 30 mins from the closing time that is posted on yelp. I called what I thought was a shop only to have Kelsey ( the owner) answer and let me know they have a cart they serve out of and that they would have a brick and mortar location hopefully very soon. Anyways, I called and she let me know that they were close to closing and wrapping up for the night so I probably missed it because of that. We were bummed, but took it on the chin and proceeded to start our way back home when Kelsey called me back and told me that she just called her employee and that if we wanted he would wait for us to come back and hold off on closing so we could get our cookie dough; She also told us where to look for the cart ( we walked right past it the first time!) We were shocked and stoked all at the same time so we rushed back to were she said it was and sure enough there it was, haha. The employee was all smiles and super nice. He hooked us up with some cookie dough and We couldn't t be more happy about the experience. Kelsey and her staff went above and beyond. y'all should check them out. Top notch service and delicious cookie dough. You can't go wrong!
author: Lynn E.
